glossdef.p: A building membrane with a reflective surface such as a reflective foil laminate, reflective barrier, foil batt or the like capable of reducing radiant heat flow.

ul.li: Typical R-Values achieved by adding reflective insulation are given in the explanatory information accompanying Section 13 of the ABCB Housing Provisions. Information on specific products may be obtained from reflective insulation manufacturers.

The surface of reflective insulation may be described in terms of its emittance (or infra-red emittance) or in terms of its reflectance (or solar reflectance). Generally, for the surface of a particular reflective insulation: emittance + reflectance = 1.
Some types of reflective insulation may also serve the purposes of waterproofing or vapour proofing.
